jaxparrow.tools.geometry module¶

jaxparrow.tools.geometry.compute_advection_u(u: ndarray | MaskedArray, v: ndarray | MaskedArray, dx: ndarray | MaskedArray, dy: ndarray | MaskedArray) → ndarray¶

Computes the advection term for a velocity field in the direction x. The function also interpolate the values to a V point

Parameters:

  • u (Union[np.ndarray, np.ma.MaskedArray]) – U velocity

  • v (Union[np.ndarray, np.ma.MaskedArray]) – V velocity

  • dx (Union[np.ndarray, np.ma.MaskedArray]) – spatial steps along x

  • dy (Union[np.ndarray, np.ma.MaskedArray]) – spatial steps along y

Returns:

advection term

Return type:

np.ndarray

jaxparrow.tools.geometry.compute_advection_u_jax(u: ndarray | Array, v: ndarray | Array, dx: ndarray, dy: ndarray) → Array¶

Computes the advection term for a velocity field in the direction x. The function also interpolate the values to a V point

Parameters:

  • u (Union[np.ndarray, jax.Array]) – U velocity

  • v (Union[np.ndarray, jax.Array]) – V velocity

  • dx (np.ndarray) – spatial steps along x

  • dy (np.ndarray) – spatial steps along y

Returns:

advection term

Return type:

jax.Array

jaxparrow.tools.geometry.compute_derivative(field: ndarray | MaskedArray, dxy: ndarray | MaskedArray, axis: int = 0) → ndarray¶

Computes the x or y derivatives of a 2D field using finite differences

Parameters:

  • field (Union[np.ndarray, np.ma.MaskedArray]) – field values

  • dxy (Union[np.ndarray, np.ma.MaskedArray]) – spatial steps

  • axis (int, optional) – axis along which boundary conditions are applied, defaults to 0

Returns:

derivatives

Return type:

np.ndarray

Computes the gradient of a field

  • dy (Union[np.ndarray, np.ma.MaskedArray]) – spatial steps along y

Computes the gradient of a field

  • dx (np.ndarray) – spatial steps along x

  • dy (np.ndarray) – spatial steps along y

Returns:

Return type:

jaxparrow.tools.geometry.compute_spatial_step(lat: ndarray | MaskedArray, lon: ndarray | MaskedArray, bounds: Tuple[float, float] = (100.0, 10000.0), fill_value: float = 1000000000000.0) → Tuple[ndarray, ndarray]¶

Computes dx and dy spatial steps of a grid defined by lat, lon. It makes use of the distance-on-a-sphere formula with Taylor expansion approximations of cos and arccos functions to avoid truncation issues.

Parameters:

  • lat (Union[np.ndarray, np.ma.MaskedArray]) – latitude

  • lon (Union[np.ndarray, np.ma.MaskedArray]) – longitude

  • bounds (Tuple[float, float], optional) – range of acceptable values, defaults to (1e2, 1e4). Out of this range, set to fill_value

  • fill_value (float, optional) – flll value, defaults to 1e12

Returns:

dx and dy spatial steps

Return type:

Tuple[np.ndarray, np.ndarray]

jaxparrow.tools.geometry.interpolate(field: ndarray | MaskedArray, axis: int = 0) → ndarray¶

Interpolates the values of a field in the y direction

Parameters:

  • field (Union[np.ndarray, np.ma.MaskedArray]) – field values

  • axis (int, optional) – axis along which boundary conditions are applied, defaults to 0

Returns:

interpolated field values

Return type:

np.ndarray
